title: Example worksheet
text:
First we need to load the required R packages. Please wait a moment until the live R session is fully set up and all packages are loaded.








Next we take a look at the data. We’ll be working with the penguins dataset from the palmerpenguins package.








Now make a scatter plot of bill length versus body mass, coloring the points by penguin species.















Hint 1





The dataset is provided as the argument to the ggplot() function.
ggplot(penguins) +
  aes(___) +
  ___()











Hint 2





The variable body_mass_g goes on the x axis, the variable bill_length_mm goes on the y axis, and species is used to assign color.
ggplot(penguins) +
  aes(body_mass_g, bill_length_mm, color = species) +
  ___()











Solution





The complete code to make the requested scatter plot. Use na.rm = TRUE to avoid warnings about missing data values.
ggplot(penguins) +
  aes(body_mass_g, bill_length_mm, color = species) +
  geom_point(na.rm = TRUE)

title: Teaching data visualization with R entirely in Quarto
text: This page contains materials for Claus O. Wilke’s talk at Posit::conf(2025). You can see the sources here: https://github.com/clauswilke/PositConf2025

title: Teaching data visualization with R entirely in Quarto
text:
Installation and setup
To enable live R exercises, install the quarto-live extension:
quarto add r-wasm/quarto-live
(The github repo already comes with this installation pre-packaged.)
For documentation on this extension, see here: https://r-wasm.github.io/quarto-live/

title: Teaching data visualization with Rentirely in Quarto
section: Components of an R-based data science class
text:
Components of an R-based data science class


Slides with code and outputxaringan / beamer / …
Websitedistill / blogdown / …
Interactive exerciseslearnr
Student assignmentsRMarkdown templates
Demo/support appsshiny apps



Many of these technologies pose challenges

title: Teaching data visualization with Rentirely in Quarto
text:
Challenges: Interactive exercises


The learnr package requires a running webserver
Alternatively, students can run learnr documents locally (confusing and ugly)

title: Teaching data visualization with Rentirely in Quarto
text:
Challenges: Student assignments


In general, pdf is the best format for submissions
Converting markdown into pdf is complicated

title: Teaching data visualization with Rentirely in Quarto
text:
Challenges: Demo/support apps


Same problems as learnr documents, we need a webserver or run locally
